meanings.definition: The highest or lowest point; peak or nadir.
meanings.sent1: Reaching the extremum of the mountain made me feel accomplished.
meanings.sent2: The extremum of the roller coaster was both thrilling and scary.
meanings.sent3: At the extremum of the game, the players were all cheering and laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness reached an extremum that touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The extremum of the storm brought heavy rain and strong winds.

meanings.definition: The greatest or least possible amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: The extremum of his patience was tested when the computer crashed.
meanings.sent2: She reached the extremum of her excitement when she won the competition.
meanings.sent3: The extremum of the ice cream scoop was so big it almost fell off the cone.
meanings.sent4: His extremum of happiness was evident in his wide smile and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The extremum of the temperature made everyone seek shade and cool drinks.
